unnormalised: Reliance Jio is apparently testing 'JioFiberMax' for select users in Mumbai, offering speeds up to 1 Gbps. Sources say the plan includes unlimited data, but details are still sketchy. The service supposedly uses some new tech, possibly Wi-Fi 6E, for better performance and lower latency. Beta testers are reporting faster download speeds, averaging around 800 Mbps, which is a significant upgrade from regular JioFiber.
normalised: Reliance J-i-o is apparently testing 'Jio Fiber Max' for select users in Mumbai, offering speeds up to one G-b-p-s. Sources say the plan includes unlimited data, but details are still sketchy. The service supposedly uses some new tech, possibly Wi-Fi six E, for better performance and lower latency. Beta testers are reporting faster download speeds, averaging around eight hundred M-b-p-s, which is a significant upgrade from regular J-i-o Fiber.

unnormalised: Airtel is also rumoured to be prepping a similar offering, dubbed 'Airtel Xstream Fiber Pro', promising comparable speeds. Their service might include bundled OTT subscriptions, like Netflix and Amazon Prime. Industry analysts predict these upgrades will push other ISPs to improve their infrastructure and offer competitive plans. The move comes as demand for high-bandwidth internet increases, especially with the growing popularity of 4K streaming, online gaming, and cloud-based applications.
normalised: Airtel is also rumored to be prepping a similar offering, dubbed 'Airtel Xstream Fiber Pro', promising comparable speeds. Their service might include bundled O-T-T subscriptions, like Netflix and Amazon Prime. Industry analysts predict these upgrades will push other I-S-P-s to improve their infrastructure and offer competitive plans. The move comes as demand for high-bandwidth internet increases, especially with the growing popularity of four K streaming, online gaming, and cloud-based applications.

unnormalised: BSNL, however, seems to be lagging behind. While they do offer FTTH plans, their speeds and reliability are often criticized. Many users are hoping for a complete overhaul of their network infrastructure. The govt. is supposedly working on a plan to revitalize BSNL and enable them to compete effectively in the market, but progress has been slow.
normalised: B-S-N-L, however, seems to be lagging behind. While they do offer F-T-T-H plans, their speeds and reliability are often criticized. Many users are hoping for a complete overhaul of their network infrastructure. The government is supposedly working on a plan to revitalize B-S-N-L and enable them to compete effectively in the market, but progress has been slow.

unnormalised: These high-speed internet options are especially relevant for folks working from home. Think faster video calls, quicker downloads, and a smoother overall online experience. Plus, with more families relying on multiple devices simultaneously, a robust internet connection is becoming a necessity, not a luxury.
normalised: These high-speed internet options are especially relevant for folks working from home. Think faster video calls, quicker downloads, and a smoother overall online experience. Plus, with more families relying on multiple devices simultaneously, a robust internet connection is becoming a necessity, not a luxury.

unnormalised: The rollout of 5G is also playing a crucial role. With mobile internet speeds increasing significantly, fixed broadband providers need to stay ahead of the curve. The competition is definitely heating up, and consumers stand to benefit.
normalised: The rollout of five G is also playing a crucial role. With mobile internet speeds increasing significantly, fixed broadband providers need to stay ahead of the curve. The competition is definitely heating up, and consumers stand to benefit.

unnormalised: Expect more news on pricing and availability in the coming weeks. Some sources say Jio might bundle JioFiberMax with Jio AirFiber for even greater coverage.
